meanings.definition: Pleasant, agreeable, or attractive in appearance or character.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was the nicest little dog I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: She always wore the nicest dresses to parties.
meanings.sent3: The nicest flowers in the garden seemed to be smiling at the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as sweet as the nicest melody ever composed.
meanings.sent5: The nicest sunset painted the sky in shades of pink and gold.

meanings.sent1: He was the nicest person, always helping others in need.
meanings.sent2: The nicest gesture was when she shared her lunch with a classmate.
meanings.sent3: The nicest old man in town would give candy to all the children.
meanings.sent4: Her nicest smile could brighten even the gloomiest day.
meanings.sent5: The nicest act of kindness was when they rescued the stranded kitten.

meanings.sent1: The nicest part of the movie was the happy ending.
meanings.sent2: Eating ice cream on a hot day is the nicest treat.
meanings.sent3: The nicest surprise was finding a $20 bill in an old jacket.
meanings.sent4: The nicest feeling in the world is a warm hug from a loved one.
meanings.sent5: The nicest dream she had was flying through the clouds like a bird.
